intro: Lethea oregana, commonly known as the Oregon lethea, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal practices. Lethea oregana is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and maintaining soil stability in its native habitat.
